content: {name= 'John'; age= '18'; country= 'Turkey'; curvisa= 'No'; time_to_get_to_US= '1 year'; reason='university'}

Based on your background and purpose of visit, I recommend applying for an F-1 student visa to study in the United States. As a Turkish national intending to pursue university education in the U.S., the F-1 visa is specifically designed for individuals like you who plan to enroll in academic programs at accredited institutions.

Since you mentioned that you have one year to prepare for your journey, this should provide ample time to research universities, apply, and obtain the necessary documentation for your F-1 visa application. It's important to note that the F-1 visa requires acceptance from a Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP)-certified school and proof of financial means to cover tuition and living expenses during your studies.

As an F-1 visa holder, you will be allowed to enter the United States up to 30 days before your program start date. Additionally, you may be eligible for Optional Practical Training (OPT) after completing your studies, which can provide valuable work experience in your field of study.

Remember to check the specific requirements and procedures for the F-1 visa on the official website of the U.S. Department of State and consult with your designated school's international student office for guidance throughout the application process. Good luck with your university journey in the United States!
